publications.name: Strain rates along the Alpine-Himalayan belt from a comprehensive GNSS velocity field
publications.summary: In this study, we derive a strain-rate field for the Alpine-Himalayan Belt from a large compilation of GNSS velocities. We then compare the resulting surface deformation patterns with seismic strain rates, stress indicators, and mantle deformation inferred from seismic anisotropy.

publications.name: Resolving the slip-rate inconsistency of the northern Dead Sea fault
publications.summary: We show that the high geologic slip rate along the northern Dead Sea fault might be inflated by earthquake clustering and suggest that the slip-rate decrease from south to north could be explained by splay faults and diffuse offshore deformation.

publications.name: Interseismic deformation in the Gulf of Aqaba from GPS measurements
publications.summary: We derive a new GNSS velocity field around the Dead Sea Fault in the Gulf of Aqaba, showing that the southernmost segment is likely creeping and documenting long-lasting postseismic transient deformation persisting more than 20 years after the 1995 Nuweiba earthquake.
